text: ヨナも一緒に行っちゃダメ
translation: Can't Yona come along too?

vocabulary.meaning: contraction of 行っては (to go)

grammar: ～ちゃダメ is a casual way to say 'must not' or 'can't' (from ～てはいけない)

text: 今日は狩りをすることになると思うからやめておいた方がいいな
translation: I think I'll end up hunting today, so you'd better stay home.

vocabulary.meaning: to refrain from, to not do

grammar: ～ことになる indicates something that will come about/be decided

text: 帰りにまたヨナの好きそうな本を借りてきてやるから
translation: I'll borrow a book you might like on my way back.

vocabulary.meaning: to go and come back (with something)

grammar: ～てやる is casual for doing something for someone (usually younger/lower status); ～そうな means 'seems like, looks like'

text: ありがとうヨナ待ってる
translation: Thank you! Yona will be waiting!

text: じゃあ行ってくるよ
translation: Alright, I'm heading out.
grammar: 行ってくる is the standard phrase when leaving home (implying you'll return)

text: ホポルさんのいる図書館に行かなきゃ
translation: I need to go to the library where Popola is.
grammar: ～なきゃ is casual contraction of ～なければならない (must do)

text: おはよう / 最近ヨナちゃんの調子はどう?
translation: Good morning. / How has Yona been doing lately?

text: 相変わらず席が止まらないんです / そう心配ね
translation: Her coughing still won't stop. / I see, that's worrying.
grammar: ～んです adds explanation/emphasis. Note: 席 is a transcription error for 咳 (cough)

text: 少しでもヨナが元気になればいいんだけど
translation: I just wish Yona could get even a little better...
grammar: ～ばいいんだけど expresses a wish that may be difficult to fulfill

text: 僕には何もできない / そんなことないわ
translation: There's nothing I can do... / That's not true.

vocabulary.meaning: can do, to be able to

grammar: そんなことない is used to deny/refute what someone said

text: あなたは立派なお兄ちゃんよ / そうだ
translation: You're a wonderful big brother. / Oh, that's right.

text: 今日はこれを頼みたいんだけれど / 商店街から仕事の依頼があったの
translation: I'd like to ask you something today. / There's a job request from the shopping district.
grammar: ～たいんだけれど is a polite way to express wanting to ask something

text: 北平原の羊から肉を取ってきてほしいそうよ / わかったすぐ行くよ
translation: They want you to get meat from the sheep in the Northern Plains. / Got it, I'll go right away.
grammar: ～てほしい expresses wanting someone to do something; ～そうよ is feminine hearsay

text: 北平原に行くなら地図を持って行って
translation: If you're going to the Northern Plains, take a map with you.
grammar: ～なら is a conditional meaning 'if (that's the case)'

text: 必ず役に立つわ
translation: It will definitely be useful.

vocabulary.meaning: to be useful, to be helpful

text: それから / ついでに依頼の人から薬草を3個買ってきてもらえる
translation: Also... / While you're at it, could you buy 3 medicinal herbs from the requester?
grammar: ～てもらえる is a polite request form (could you do... for me?)

text: ちょうど切らしちゃって
translation: We just ran out.

vocabulary.meaning: to run out of, to be out of stock

grammar: ～ちゃって is casual form of ～てしまって (unfortunately did, regrettably)

text: はいこれがお金よ
translation: Here, this is the money.

text: こんなにいっぱいお金が余っちゃうよ
translation: This is way too much money, there'll be a lot left over!

vocabulary.meaning: to be left over, to remain
casual form of ～てしまう (end up doing)

text: 余ったらヨナちゃんへの薬草でも買ってあげなさい
translation: If there's any left over, buy some herbs for Yona.
grammar: ～てあげなさい is a gentle command to do something for someone; ～たら is conditional (if)

text: それは
translation: That's...

text: お願いね
translation: Please do.
grammar: お願いね is a soft/feminine way to say please

text: いつもありがとうポポルさん
translation: Thank you as always, Popola.

text: 急にどうしたの / 身寄りのない僕ら兄弟を気にかけてくれて
translation: What's this all of a sudden? / For looking after us siblings who have no family.

vocabulary.meaning: to care about, to worry about

grammar: 身寄りのない means 'without relatives/family'

text: 僕らポポルさんや村の人にはとても感謝してるんです
translation: We're very grateful to you and the villagers, Popola.

text: 困った時はお互い様よ
translation: We help each other in times of trouble.

vocabulary.meaning: to be troubled, to be in difficulty
we're in the same boat, mutual, it works both ways

grammar: お互い様 is a set phrase meaning 'it's mutual' or 'we help each other'

text: みんな早くヨナちゃんの元気な姿が見たいのよ
translation: Everyone wants to see Yona healthy again soon.

text: だから頑張ってねお兄ちゃん
translation: So hang in there, big brother.

vocabulary.meaning: to do one's best, to hang in there
hang in there, good luck, do your best

text: うんわかった
translation: Yeah, got it.

text: ヨナ / あ、お兄ちゃん / ダメじゃないか、ちゃんと家で寝てなきゃ
translation: Yona! / Oh, big brother! / You shouldn't be out here, you need to stay home and rest!
grammar: ダメじゃないか is a mild scolding expression (isn't it no good?)

text: ほら、服のリボンもほどけてるぞ
translation: Look, your ribbon has come undone too.
grammar: ～てるぞ is masculine casual for ～ている (ongoing state)

text: ごめんなさい
translation: I'm sorry.

text: でもヨナね、病気を早く治す方法を探してたの
translation: But Yona was looking for a way to get better quickly.

vocabulary.meaning: to search for, to look for

text: ヨナ、大丈夫、ヨナは心配しなくてもいいんだよ
translation: Yona, it's okay. You don't need to worry.
grammar: ～なくてもいい means 'don't have to', 'no need to'

text: いっぱい食べてよく寝たら、ちゃんとよくなるから / 本当?
translation: If you eat lots and sleep well, you'll definitely get better. / Really?
grammar: ～たら is a conditional (if/when)

text: もちろん / それじゃあお兄ちゃんは仕事に行くから
translation: Of course. / Well then, big brother has to go to work.

text: おとなしく家に帰るんだぞ
translation: Be good and go home, okay?

vocabulary.meaning: obediently, quietly, like a good child

grammar: ～んだぞ is a masculine emphatic command/instruction

text: 今減り続ける人口と / 蔓延する奇病が / 世界を悩ませているらしい
translation: The continuously declining population / and the spreading strange disease / seem to be plaguing the world.
grammar: ～続ける means 'to continue to ~'; ～らしい indicates hearsay (I hear that)

text: 魔物と呼ばれる黒い化け物も / 人々の生活を脅かすようになってきた
translation: Black monsters called 'Shades' / have also started threatening people's lives.
grammar: ～ようになってきた means 'has come to ~', 'has started to ~' (gradual change)

text: でも僕にとって気がかりなことはただ一つ
translation: But for me, there's only one thing that worries me.
grammar: ～にとって means 'for (someone)', 'from (someone's) perspective'

text: 妹のヨナと一緒に / 今日をちゃんと生き延びられるかどうか
translation: Whether my sister Yona and I / can properly survive another day.
grammar: ～かどうか means 'whether or not'

text: 子供だけで生きていくのは色々大変だけど
translation: Living as just children is hard in many ways, but...

vocabulary.meaning: to go on living, to make a living

text: 優しい人の多いこの村でなら / なんとかやっていける気がする
translation: In this village with so many kind people / I feel like we can somehow manage.

vocabulary.meaning: to feel like, to have a feeling

grammar: ～気がする means 'I feel like ~', 'I have a sense that ~'

text: いややっていかなくちゃならないんだ / 世のためにも
translation: No, we have to make it work. / For Yona's sake too.
grammar: ～なくちゃならない means 'must do'. Note: 世 may be mistranscription of ヨナ

text: 羊の肉は集まったし村に戻ろう
translation: I've gathered the sheep meat, let's head back to the village.
grammar: ～し indicates a reason (since...); ～よう is volitional (let's)

text: さあ魔物がこんなところにも
translation: Whoa, there are Shades even in a place like this!
grammar: ～にも means 'even in/at'

text: 魔物が村のこんな近くに現れるなんて
translation: I can't believe Shades appeared so close to the village...
grammar: ～なんて expresses surprise or disbelief

text: 安心して帰りにも行けないな / お店の人に肉を届けに行かないと
translation: Can't even go home in peace... / I need to deliver the meat to the shop.
grammar: ～ないと is short for ～ないといけない (must do)

text: 羊の肉集めてきたよ / 助かったよ
translation: I've gathered the sheep meat. / That's a big help!

vocabulary.meaning: to go and do (and come back)
to be saved, to be helped

grammar: 助かった is a common way to thank someone for help

text: 偶然の羊肉ブームでね / これ少ないけど取っておいてくれ
translation: There's been a sudden mutton boom. / Here, it's not much, but keep this.

vocabulary.meaning: to keep, to save, to set aside

text: あとポポルさんにもお礼を伝えておいてくれるから
translation: Also, please pass my thanks to Popola.

vocabulary.meaning: to convey, to tell, to pass on

grammar: ～ておく means 'to do in advance/preparation'

text: うん伝えておくね
translation: Sure, I'll let her know.
grammar: ～ておく means 'to do in advance/preparation'

text: 確かポポルさんは薬草を3つ欲しいって言ってたっけ
translation: I think Popola said she wanted 3 medicinal herbs...

vocabulary.meaning: if I remember correctly, I think

grammar: ～っけ indicates trying to recall something

text: 羊の肉届けてきたよ / あと薬草を3つだったね
translation: I've delivered the sheep meat. / And it was 3 herbs, right?

text: よかったわ / これで少しは食料不足も抑えられるでしょう
translation: That's great. / This should help ease the food shortage a bit.

vocabulary.meaning: to suppress, to ease, to hold down

text: 薬草も助かったわ / ありがとう
translation: The herbs are a big help too. / Thank you.

vocabulary.meaning: to be a help, to be saved

text: 今日のお仕事はこれでおしまいです / お疲れ様
translation: That's all for today's work. / Good job.

vocabulary.meaning: good work, thanks for your effort

text: ヨナちゃんのためにも早く帰ってあげて
translation: Go home early for Yona's sake too.
grammar: ～のために means 'for the sake of'

text: ありがとう / ことあった 外の世界な
translation: Thank you. / [Transcription unclear]
grammar: Note: Second part appears to be a transcription error

text: なしない
translation: [Transcription unclear]
grammar: Note: Appears to be a transcription error

text: 今日もちゃんと方を読んで待ってたんだけど 全部
translation: I was reading books properly while waiting today too, and...
grammar: Note: 方 likely should be 本 (book)

text: 読んじゃっ a とねー
translation: I read them all!

vocabulary.meaning: did completely (casual past of ～てしまった)

grammar: Note: Transcription error, likely 読んじゃったのね (You read them all, huh)

text: あ、そうだ。昨日ポポルさんに月の涙の伝説を聞いたよ。
translation: Oh, that's right. Yesterday I heard about the Lunar Tear legend from Popola.

text: 月の涙?それ、何?
translation: Lunar Tear? What's that?

text: 花の名前だよ。その花を見つけるとお金持ちになれるんだってさ。
translation: It's a flower's name. They say if you find it, you'll become rich.
grammar: ～んだって is casual hearsay (they say that); ～さ adds casual assertion

text: 月の涙を見つけたら、ヨナの好きなものを何でもお腹いっぱい食べさせてあげる。
translation: If I find a Lunar Tear, I'll let Yona eat as much of whatever she wants.
grammar: ～させてあげる is causative + giving (let someone do for their benefit); ～たら is conditional (if)

text: ヨナ、病気が治るお薬が欲しいな。
translation: Yona wants medicine that will cure her sickness.

text: うん、どんな病気だって治す薬も変えるよ
translation: Yeah, we could even buy medicine that cures any illness.

vocabulary.meaning: any kind of, what kind of

grammar: ～だって means 'even'; Note: 変える likely should be 買える (can buy)

text: ヨナ、どうかした? / うん、なんでもない
translation: Yona, what's wrong? / Nothing, it's nothing.

text: おやすみなさい
translation: Good night.

text: じゃあ今日もポポルさんのところに行ってくれよ
translation: Alright, I'm off to Popola's place again today.
grammar: Note: Likely meant 行ってくるよ (I'm heading out)

text: 今日はおとなしくしてるんだよ
translation: Be good and stay put today, okay?

vocabulary.meaning: be doing (contraction of している)

grammar: ～んだよ is gentle emphasis/instruction

text: 今日も何か手伝えることありますか
translation: Is there anything I can help with today too?

text: あるにはあるんだけど
translation: Well, there is something, but...
grammar: ～にはある is an emphatic construction meaning 'there certainly is, but...' (implying hesitation)

text: ちょっと大変なお仕事なのよ / 大丈夫任せて
translation: It's a bit of a tough job... / No problem, leave it to me!

text: 本当に
translation: Really?

text: 北平原の橋が壊れているのは知っているかしら
translation: Do you know that the bridge in the Northern Plains is broken?
grammar: ～かしら is feminine wondering/questioning

text: うん柱が腐って落ちちゃったんだよね
translation: Yeah, the pillars rotted and fell, right?

text: その橋を大工職人さんたちが修理していたんだけど
translation: The carpenters were repairing that bridge, but...

text: そこに運悪く魔物が現れたの
translation: Unfortunately, Shades appeared there.

text: えあんなところにも魔物が
translation: What? Shades even in a place like that?

text: え曇っていたから魔物も活動できたみたい
translation: It seems the Shades could be active because it was cloudy.
grammar: ～みたい means 'it seems like'

text: そのうちの大工さんが一人大怪我しちゃったの
translation: One of the carpenters got seriously injured.

vocabulary.meaning: ended up doing (casual ～してしまった)

text: それでみんな身動きが取れなくて
translation: So everyone is stuck and can't move.

text: 僕が魔物を倒してきます
translation: I'll go defeat the Shades.

vocabulary.meaning: to go do and come back

text: でも危ないわ
translation: But it's dangerous!

text: 大丈夫僕は剣の腕だって鍛えてるから
translation: It's okay, I've been training my sword skills.

vocabulary.meaning: has been doing (contraction of ている)

grammar: ～だって means 'even'

text: 村の誰にも負けないくらい強いんです
translation: I'm strong enough that I won't lose to anyone in the village.
grammar: ～くらい here means 'to the extent that'

text: 昨日だって村の入り口にいた魔物を倒したんだ
translation: Just yesterday I defeated a Shade at the village entrance.
grammar: ～だって means 'even' or emphasizes an example

text: そう本当に大丈夫なの / 任せといて
translation: Really, will you be okay? / Leave it to me!
grammar: 任せといて is casual form of 任せておいて

text: やっと片付いた
translation: Finally finished.

vocabulary.meaning: to be put in order, to be finished, to be settled

text: これで当分は魔物も出てこないだろう
translation: With this, the Shades probably won't appear for a while.

vocabulary.meaning: for a while, for the time being

grammar: ～だろう expresses probability

text: あ、おかえりなさい / ただいま
translation: Oh, welcome back! / I'm home.

text: 大丈夫?怪我はない? / 大丈夫だよ、ポポルさん
translation: Are you okay? Are you hurt? / I'm fine, Popola.

text: あなたが出た後すごく心配になって / やっぱり頼むんじゃなかったって
translation: After you left I got really worried... / I thought maybe I shouldn't have asked you.
grammar: ～んじゃなかった expresses regret about having done something

text: 平気だよポポルさんは心配性だな
translation: I'm fine. You're such a worrywart, Popola.

text: 無事で本当によかった
translation: I'm so glad you're safe.

text: そうそう大工さんたちがあなたにお礼ですって
translation: Oh yes, the carpenters wanted to thank you.
grammar: ～ですって is casual hearsay (they said that)

text: ありがとう
translation: Thank you.

text: これでヨナちゃんに美味しいものでも食べさせてあげて
translation: Use this to get Yona something delicious to eat.

text: そうだ、ヨナちゃんって言えばお昼にここに来たわ
translation: Oh right, speaking of Yona, she came here at noon.
grammar: ～って言えば means 'speaking of'

text: え?ちゃんと寝てろって言ったのに
translation: What? I told her to stay in bed and rest!
grammar: ～のに expresses frustration that something happened despite expectations

text: まあまあ、なんだか私に聞きたいことがあったみたいよ
translation: Now, now. It seems she had something she wanted to ask me.

text: 聞きたいこと?
translation: Something she wanted to ask?

text: 外の世界の話を聞きたがってたわ
translation: She wanted to hear about the outside world.
grammar: ～たがる means 'to want to' when describing someone else's desire

text: 村の外の? / そう、なんだか熱心に聞いてきて
translation: Outside the village? / Yes, she was asking so earnestly.

text: また変な本を読んで、変な興味持ってないといいんだけど
translation: I hope she hasn't been reading strange books and getting weird ideas again...
grammar: ～といいんだけど expresses hope with some uncertainty

text: もちろん、村の外に出ちゃいけないって言っておいたから、安心して
translation: Of course, I told her she mustn't leave the village, so don't worry.
grammar: ～ちゃいけない means 'must not' (casual form of ～てはいけない)

text: よかった
translation: That's a relief.

vocabulary.meaning: I'm glad, that's good, that's a relief

text: 早く帰ってあげて、ヨナちゃんも心配しているわ
translation: Go home soon. Yona is worried about you too.

text: うん、ありがとう
translation: Yeah, thanks.

text: ヨナ?
translation: Yona?

text: どこ行っちゃったんだろう / まだ図書館にいるのかな
translation: Where did she go? / Maybe she's still at the library?
grammar: ～のかな is wondering to oneself

text: ここにはいないみたいだな / ポポルさんに聞いてみよう
translation: She doesn't seem to be here. / Let me ask Popola.
grammar: ～てみよう means 'let me try doing'

text: ポポルさんヨナが家にいないんです
translation: Popola, Yona isn't at home!
grammar: ～んです adds urgency/explanation

text: え?どうしたのかしら / 何か心当たりはないですか
translation: What? I wonder what happened? / Do you have any idea where she might be?

text: お昼にここに来てからは見かけていないけど
translation: I haven't seen her since she came here at noon...

vocabulary.meaning: to see, to catch sight of

text: その時何か言ってませんでしたか
translation: Did she say anything at that time?

text: そうね
translation: Let me think...

text: 月の涙が咲いている場所を聞かれたわ
translation: She asked me where the Lunar Tears bloom.

text: 昔は石の神殿のあたりに咲いていたっていう話をしたんだけど
translation: I told her that they used to bloom around the Shrine.
grammar: ～っていう話 means 'the story that ~'

text: 月の涙の話を / ヨナが
translation: The story about the Lunar Tear... / Yona...

text: そんなまさか / どうしたの
translation: No, it can't be... / What's wrong?

text: 昨日月の涙を見つけるとお金持ちになれるって言い伝えの話をしたんです
translation: Yesterday I told her about the legend that you'll become rich if you find a Lunar Tear.

text: え
translation: What?

text: それで何でも治す薬も買えるかって聞かれて
translation: And then she asked if we could buy medicine that cures anything...

text: じゃあヨナちゃんは
translation: Then Yona...

text: まさか自分の薬を買うために探しに行かなきゃ
translation: Don't tell me she went to find it to buy her own medicine... I have to go look for her!

vocabulary.meaning: to search for, to look for

text: 石の神殿は / 東門から行くしかないわ
translation: To get to the Shrine / you can only go through the Eastern Gate.
grammar: ～しかない means 'there's no choice but to', 'can only'

text: ありがとう
translation: Thank you!

text: ヨナ東門に行ってみよう
translation: Yona... Let me try the Eastern Gate.

text: あれは
translation: That's...

text: ヨナまさか本当に石の神殿に行ったんじゃ
translation: Yona... don't tell me she really went to the Shrine...
grammar: ～んじゃ is short for ～のではないか (wondering/fearing that something is the case)
